result.execSummary:
Isaiah K. Brimley was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Isaiah K. Brimley was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah K. Brimley

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 11:32 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Paige Metzman. 
Date and time set for hearing to review status of extradition. 
Atty Metzman advises deft will be waiving extradition. 
COURT advises deft re: rights and questions deft re: waiver of extradition. 
Deft waives extradition and signs waiver in the presence of the Court. 
COURT accepts waiver of extradition. 
Adj: 11:35 am
Review hearing on February 28, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Absolutely No contact with victim(s): YM. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:18 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Defendant appears by Zoom Video from MCJ with Atty Paige Metzman. 
Atty Metzman notes deft has not yet decided on how he wishes to proceed regarding extradition. 
Argument re: bond. 
COURT ORDERS: $50,000 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- Absolutely No contact with victim(s): YM. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
CC>>2/2/2022 at 1:00 pm with Br. 3 JA to set hearing to review extradition.
